intro: Hieracium syntomum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium syntomum is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes and seeds, making it a persistent weed in agricultural areas.
